node.title: Code as Craft
node.description: Etsy's technology blog. I've enjoyed their in-depth writeups which are often backed by comprehensive data and analysis.

node.title: Increment
node.description: A beautiful editorial website, focusing on a different software development topic each issue.

node.title: Intercom
node.description: Big focus on product management and continuous delivery best practices.

node.title: Dropbox tech blog
node.description: Some particularly interesting reads about data at scale.

node.title: A List Apart
node.description: One of the most established and well respected authorities on web design, inclusivity and accessibility. Guest posts from many leading minds.

node.title: Brad Frost
node.description: Design systems, frontend development, refreshing honesty.

node.title: Michael Lopp
node.description: Literally wrote the book on engineering management. Great slack community too.

node.title: Run Less Software
node.description: The philosophy behind software development at Intercom.

node.title: Microservice testing
node.description: A comprehensive guide to testing strategies for microservices, helping to define exactly which system is under test at each stage.

node.title: Klim Type Foundry
node.description: Amazing fonts and studies of historical typefaces.

node.title: Refactoring UI
node.description: Teaches various approaches for improving UIs

node.title: Web performance checklist
node.description: Addy Osmani will depress you by reminding you how much work is involved in building a performant UI.

node.title: Gov.UK design principles
node.description: I keep coming back to this. Clear, simple design principles and a brilliant piece of communication.

node.title: Stripping Away Cross Cutting Concerns
node.description: How to enforce sensible NFRs without requiring developers to do anything.

node.title: Policy-based authorisation
node.description: Dotnet Core does an exceptional job of authorisation. This is a good writeup of the policy system and how to use it.

node.title: Architecture patterns in dotnet core
node.description: A git repo full of examples of how to implement various architectural patterns (good accounting references).

node.title: Distributed systems theory
node.description: A good reference on the challenges of designing distributed systems

node.title: API first at Paypal
node.description: How Paypal managed their transition to an api-centric architecture.

node.title: Decoupled, immutable REST APIs with Kafka
node.description: A reliable microservice system should favour asynchronous communication, and Kafka is a good way to implement this.

node.title: GraphQL and gRPC
node.description: Buzzwords galore. Using Google's RPC protocol with GraphQL.

node.description: Hard lessons learned while implementing microservices.
